channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Workers wanted a raise, but got a 4-day workweek. Here's what happened.
item.description: San Juan County in Washington State didn't have the funds to give workers a raise, so they had to get creative.

item.title: Judge in Boston to consider latest bid to block Trump’s birthright citizenship order
item.description: A federal judge in Boston will consider a request from 18 states to block President Donald Trump’s executive order ending birthright citizenship for t...

item.title: Senate Democrats call for answers on health communications freeze and funding delays
item.description: Two letters from different groups of senators call for answers from the Trump administration about pauses in scientific communications and funding.

item.title: Oscar-nominated West Bank feature director says films 'can be part of change'
item.description: The film by a Israeli-Palestinian group follows the fight over home demolitions by the Israeli army.

item.title: 2/6: CBS Evening News
item.description: FBI agent involved in Jan. 6 probes says Trump review is 'demoralizing'; County workers wanted a raise, but got a 4-day workweek instead

item.title: Judge halts Trump's government worker buyout plan
item.description: The offer is part of an ongoing effort by the Trump administration to slash the size of the federal government.

item.title: Trump administration sues Chicago in latest crackdown on ‘sanctuary’ cities
Alabama executes man with nitrogen gas for 1991 murder and rape
item.description: His execution was the nation's fourth using nitrogen gas.

item.title: EPA employees who work on environmental justice are put on leave
item.description: In an email obtained by NPR, employees at EPA's Office of Environmental Justice and External Civil Rights were told they were on administrative leave,...

item.title: Alabama puts man to death in the nation's fourth execution using nitrogen gas
item.description: Frazier in his final words criticized Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer for not returning him to serve out a previous life sentence in her state, which d...

item.title: Trump sanctions International Criminal Court, calls it 'illegitimate'
item.description: The Hague-based body has created a "shameful moral equivalency" between Hamas and Israel, the White House says.

item.title: Member of Elon Musk's DOGE team resigns after racist posts resurface
item.description: Marko Elez had recently been given special access by a federal judge to highly sensitive payment systems in the Department of Treasury.

item.title: NCAA bars transgender athletes from women's sports after Trump order
item.description: The move came one day after President Donald Trump signed an executive order intended to ban transgender athletes from girls' and women's sports.

item.title: Argentina canal turns bright red, alarming residents
item.description: Pictures and videos show the intensely coloured water flowing into an estuary, the Rio de la Plata.

item.title: Why Trump is on the warpath in Somalia
item.description: Militants in the mountains of north-eastern Somalia have become the beating heart of Islamic State in Africa.

item.title: In Michigan, some Arab American voters revisit their support for Trump
item.description: President Trump wrote Thursday that the Gaza Strip "would be turned over to the United States by Israel at the conclusion of fighting."

item.title: EPA rushes to meet deadline to clear toxic debris from L.A. wildfire zones
item.description: An executive order signed by President Trump in late January called for the EPA to expedite its removal of hazardous materials from the Los Angeles ar...

item.title: US border czar blames leaks for hindering immigration raids in Colorado suburb spotlighted by Trump
